website_summaries.verdict: A speedier option than some other choices, and it cuts through most materials.
pros: Upload your own images, or access a good selection on Cricut's free library
Cuts through foils, leather, vinyl, and a whole lot of other good stuff
cons: Access to the extended graphics and font library requires a pay-per-image fee
Some users had problems with software

website_summaries.verdict: This machine from Cricut lets you both print and cut vinyl stickers, although you need a stable Internet connection to Cricut's web site to use it.
pros: SmartSet dial makes sure you get correct depth and pressure for any material
Upload your own image or select from Cricut's library
Double tool holder for cutting and writing or cutting and scoring
Amazing number of options for use
cons: You must have an Internet connection to use the machine
No manual feed jogger, so if vinyl gets stuck, it is difficult to remove

customer_reviews.title: Subscription required
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on valentines day for my wife. Here 2 weeks later, she gets a notice that she can no longer use the software without paying $10 month. She gets on chat with Cricut and they confirm it. So this machine is now useless to us.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: The machine does not come with software and you can't ...
customer_reviews.text: The machine does not come with software and you can't download any software onto your machine. You can only use their on-line software, which is very limiting. You can not use 3rd party software. So you have to be connected, i.e. within wifi range, to do any design work. When I'm at the coffee shop w/o access, traveling, etc... I can't do any preparatory work. Why don't they list this on the product description? Nobody else does this with their machines... I don't understand why Cricut has to...
customer_reviews.author: Martin Culpepper

customer_reviews.title: Terrible software
customer_reviews.text: What's the point of having two tool inserts when I can't score and cut in the same mat. Drawing a design takes forever, cannot set references to draw at all. For example cutting a square with a grid scored inside it doesn't seem possible in one pass. It took ages to draw four parallel lines - I had to manually enter the length and coordinates to get it working. It also looks like it isn't possible to use another software to do this. Any recommendations to do a better job would be helpful Also, the mat broke when I try to peel the sheet off as recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jason Fernando

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting this machine for so long but couldn't justify the price. Also I was super intimidated about spending all that money and not being able to figure out how to use it. Well I got it on sale on Prime Day, which was awesome. And it was super easy to use! The internet has so many helpful hints but is is truly so user friendly. Can't stop crafting!
customer_reviews.author: TRACY M HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: I have only had my machine since Christmas. It ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had my machine since Christmas. It will not turn on and Cricut has been of no help. You may want to look into a silhouette. UPDATE; It is now coming on but only cutting part of the image and making horrible noises.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Brantley

customer_reviews.title: design space is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The absolute weakest design software I have ever worked with. It took my wife and I a total of over eight hours to print fifteen 4"x4" cards. When I called cricut I was told to install on my tablet and it would be easier, no help. You would think that once you spend $300, there would be no need to spend more just to get the software to work.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated buying the Cricut for so long. I read a lot of reviews from disappointed people saying it was hard to use and that the Cricut Design Space (where you create your projects to be cut) was hard to use and expensive. Well, I haven’t felt the need to purchase anything from the design space because it’s so easy to download a free font on to your computer! There are so many free fonts on “Dafont.com” if you’ve never downloaded a font before, just watch a YouTube video and you’ll be a pro in minutes! I’m so happy with my purchase. I shouldn’t have waited so long to buy one
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but the real expense come down the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but the real expense come down the road with all the added mats and products you want to use it for. Cutting process for custom work can be slow, but for standard items, it works great. We have used it to cut leather, paper, and card stock so far. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Rex W. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Software is unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a case of a very good machine concept being destroyed by software engineers and simple greed. The operator is forced to use a web-based software program to perform any and all activities on this machine and the website is riddled with errors and is constantly down for hours at a time. Don't be fooled by other versions of the machine (i.e., Cricut Maker, etc.). They all force you to use their web based software program which is unreliable. Customer service offers absolutely no assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Melbourne

customer_reviews.title: Challenging Warranty Policy
customer_reviews.text: The machine worked flawlessly for the first month. After, several of my projects were cancelled by the machine mid-cut, which resulted in a lot of wasted vinyl and frustratingly long projects. Customer service has been challenging to work with; in order to fix the machine, they requested that I make a video and use a Windows computer to troubleshoot the machine, even though I told them that I do not have access to one. I am hopeful that they will soon honor their warranty policy without demanding that I acquire a different computer for their sake.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: So amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I saw this on amazon prime day! I had a cricut before and it sadly broke. I have been waiting to replace it and wasn't sure if I wanted another cricut. Well I took the plunge and am so glad I did! The cartridges I had from my old one can still be used, I can plan and make files from my phone using the Bluetooth capability, and the products I create are amazing! I have multiple friends asking if they can come and make stuff using it. I'm also a teacher and very excited to use it for my classroom too! So long doing everything by hand!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Newman

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE MACHINE. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: I am nearly in tears with regret over my decision to purchase this machine. I can't align for ANYTHING, no matter how many times I go through the calibration song and dance. And when you use the "print then cut" feature, it AUTOMATICALLY CONVERTS YOUR IMAGES TO A LOW RESOLUTION BEFORE YOU PRINT. Why would anybody want to do that? Such garbage. DO NOT BUY. Trying to get a refund from manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Gramelspacher

customer_reviews.title: Complete Software Fail
customer_reviews.text: There is no installable software and Cricut has locked out all 3rd party software vendors from working with their machines. They force you to use an online only version with limited capabilities. Anything beyond the simplest project, particularly with text, will cause extreme slowdowns. I can't recommend this to anyone outside of the most casual users, and even this is a stretch. **Update 6/10/2017** Online software is still a joke. Constantly slowing down on big projects. Whenever Flash updates, expect major problems for several days. This machine is sucking the fun out of crafting :-(
customer_reviews.author: nXgravity

customer_reviews.title: do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: it's not even been a week and i'm having issues, sometimes it ruins a paper and doesnt cut correctly, or it just marks the paper while its on cardstock, other times it disconnects mid cutting, i was really excited to buy this machine but now it just takes too long to cut one thing. do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I've ever made!
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this machine! When I first received it, I was completely overwhelmed. I didn't even take it out of the box for a while. Then I slowly did research on YouTube, Facebook beginner cricut boards, ect. and learned how to make projects. The machine is more than paying for itself just from me making things for friends and family. It's helped to supplement our small income. Don't be overwhelmed when you receive it! There is so much great advice on the "cricut newbies" board on Facebook. They are quick to help and there are lots of files available too. Have fun crafting!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Charbonneau

customer_reviews.title: after a month I keep getting Error -44 and it ...
customer_reviews.text: after a month I keep getting Error -44 and it won't cut any pattern without restarting or resetting the system! I am past for 14 day return and now have a machine that doesn't work. I called the company and they determined it had issues. Within 2 hours it was on its way with prepaid label back and new replacement! Great customer service. Can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Does not allow you to do multiple images on a full page!!!
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours trying to get this thing to do multiple images on a single sheet of paper but it cannot do that. It must only do two images taking up most of the paper or nothing at all. Theres a lot of tricks to get this thing to work properly which is unfortunate. I did not pay $200 for tricks to get the machine to work the way I want it to. Definitely not worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kenji

customer_reviews.title: Software is absolutely hopeless. All versions, All platforms. Tech support is clueless.
customer_reviews.text: Is there a 0 star option. The product might work fine... If the software weren't hopelessly obtuse and the tech support weren't rude and incompetent. I have followed all online instructions and have tried multiple OS systems and applications and none of the software will work without making me leap through hoop after hoop. Asking tech support for help just gets, "could you reinstall X software and reboot your machine". I have reinstalled and reinstalled and checked online forums and looked at software versions and plugins etc etc. Their tech support is like the IT crowd and have asked me 20 times if I have tried turning it off and on again.
customer_reviews.author: Shlepzig

customer_reviews.title: A review on EXPERIENCE and not product itself.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particular machine via amazon, the WORST decision. I bought it as new and received an opened box with parts floating around inside the machine it'self. A cricut pen, which was OPENED and dried out. There was no slip cover. I was very confused so I contacted Cricut directly and asked them about it. They checked the serial number and it was registered to another human. HORRIBLE, Amazon. I HIGHLY recommend ordering via cricut's direct site. Better service and quality 100%.
customer_reviews.author: MohrDohr

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Read The Bad Reviews
customer_reviews.text: The bad reviews on this product are just ridiculous you do not need the cricut design space subscription to use your cricut you can just do some YouTube research and know all you need to know.. Also Cricut has a App for your phone so you only need your cell service to use this cutter this is an amazing product
customer_reviews.author: Megan Leeane Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great price! I am still learning how to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price! I am still learning how to use the machine because it doesn't come with a true manual. You need to watch A LOT of you tube tutorials to learn how to properly use the machine. I suggest you take notes because there are so many different things to memorize. That is the reason why I give it 4 stars and not 5 stars. I wish I had a paper manual to refer to.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I have an older one of these that I bought at hobby lobby, which still works great after a year. I bought a new one from amazon and the stupid thing stopped cutting right after a week. It won’t cut through materials no matter how many cuts. The image will get shifted on each additional cut and so you have a bunch of wonky looking designs. I’ve tried new mats, new blades, new blade holders and even different brands of mats and blades. Nothing I have tried has worked. My old machine still cuts fine but this one was just a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Annabeth Hartford

customer_reviews.title: Required Software to Run Ruins Product
customer_reviews.text: I would love this product if the software required to use it wasn’t utter crap. The design space is slow and buggy. It takes fifteen to twenty minutes to do something that should take five minutes. I have lost hours of work from timeouts and freezes on this stupid thing. The kicker? To use this machine you HAVE to have design space. That said, I love the machine when I have no time crunch and am feeling patient... but if I had known how awful their software was before I purchased, I would have purchased a competitions product.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have used it more within that first month so I could have realized it’s a terrible product to return it and get my money back. The machine works decently but the program is written so terribly that it brings the product down. I have never successfully completed a project without having to do it multiple times and without wasting product. It never works the way it says it will, ever project is trial and error when using the cricut.
customer_reviews.author: Cznuk

customer_reviews.title: I’m giving this machine 5 stars because it’s amazing at what it does unfortunately I had to return ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this machine 5 stars because it’s amazing at what it does unfortunately I had to return it because I was hoping to get a bigger contour cut for heat transfer images the cut size was only 6.750x 9.250 and I needed it to be at least 11x17. This machine is perfect for someone that is doing crafting, book scraping, small heat transfer, vinyl lettering etc. it’s awesome at what it does. Since I couldn’t use it for bigger heat transfers it did do an amazing job contour cutting my small logos. So for smaller projects it’s amazing I just made a mistake picking this one out with out doing more research. For the crafter and hobbyists it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan (DJ XCELLONE)

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Set up was very very easy. Watched a few YouTube videos to see what I needed to buy/ how to get started. Very easy to use machine and the app for it is great. I have made a few projects so far and love it! Occasionally the vinyl needs to be weeded on my own, but that is not due to the machine not cutting, it is due to me choosing a very skinny font. When beginning I would suggest bolding a word when you try it out just to get the hang of it using a thicker piece of work. Once you get it then move on to skinny fonts. Love this machine !
customer_reviews.author: angela g.

customer_reviews.title: HEAVEN
customer_reviews.text: Okay, maybe it is because i started out with the Cameo 3, but this thing is a little slice of heaven. It took 3 hours for my genius husband to help me figure out how to cut HTV on the cameo, and even then we still had to cut certain spots ourselves. It was a nightmare. Took me less than 3 minutes from the time I first plugged my Cricut in, until my HTV design was done and cut. This thing is AMAZING. way outbeats the cameo. Only thing is i wish it was better at cutting felt, but I hear the maker is good at that.
customer_reviews.author: AMKZN

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again... See full review.
customer_reviews.text: OOBE - No drivers included. No software. To use this it requires Internet, so don't plan on setting this up or using it without access to the internet. Windows 7 does attempt to install drivers but fails. I will update my review as I progress in its use. So far, not impressed at all. Update: works fine with current software, and they now have cricut software for offline use. Still wish it could be a network printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Elzy

customer_reviews.title: Stops during cuts
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this unit in January. However, the machine stalls when making cuts and power light would blink red. I contacted Cricut and they said that there is nothing they can do because the machine was shipped outside of the US. I am now stuck with a practically new machine that has a problem and Cricut cannot solve and won't replace.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney J.

customer_reviews.title: Do your research about OS updates first
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my machine in 2018 and it worked great for almost a year. Then the software issue came up. My machine would not work with my Mac, iPad or iPhone because I had not updated the software on any of my devices. It was not by choice my Mac and iPad could not be updated anymore and my iPhone didn’t have enough storage. I do not recommend that you buy this machine because it will only work with the latest OS and if you can’t update your devices like me then your out of luck; and will have a $300 machine just sitting there.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this machine. I am making all of the flowers out of paper for my wedding. I did alot of research about die cutting machines trying to find the right one to help me out. I chose this machine based on reviews and am so please. It is SO easy to use. Setup instructions are simple clear and easy to understand. Design space download and set up were also incredibly easy to navigate. The machine itself came in clean working condition. Shipping was very fast. All around great buy! All my wedding flowers look AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Power button blinking red and white
customer_reviews.text: Just got this brand new machine and it’s already giving me issues. The power button is blinking red and white I’m so upset cause I have projects to do and can’t cause of this issue I want my money back or a brand new machine or help me fix this issue ASAP!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kisha Cornett

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and looked used
customer_reviews.text: I love the actual machine, but I’m pretty sure mine was previously used or returned. The power cord was all unwrapped and just thrown in the box. There appeared to be cat hair on the machine itself. And it’s missing the mat board and supplies to do the setup project. I’m mostly angry about not having the mat board. Can’t do much without that!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Myers

customer_reviews.title: Broke out of no where; Cricut will not replace
customer_reviews.text: I got this Cricut Explore Air 2 for Christmas of 2017. I only used it for personal crafting so it did not get a lot of wear and tear. One day it was working great and the next day it would not turn on. I reached out to Cricut member care only to learn that even though it is “an issue with the machine” there is nothing they would do and I’m just out $230. Terrible customer service for an even worse product that broke for no reason. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Defective machine.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! I had the cricut explore air 1 and worked perfectly. This one has lots of defects I dont know if it is all of them or just mine that came defective. The scoring tool wont score properly. The sensor for print then cut doesnt work properly as well. It is not well callibrated. Terrible expetience. Ended up using my old machine because this one wont work.
customer_reviews.author: Anacecilia Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: So far so great.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it!! It makes my life a little easier. I am a digital artist that is opening an etsy shop with stickers, keychains, and shirts in the future. Print to cut stickers: I am a stickler for perfection. I find that it can be a little off when cutting in a certain area. I did not rate down because I most likely need to recalibrate a little better. But a warning to others: test print and cut and calibrate on your normal paper first! Cuttting vinyl: its awesome. Point blank. I have made two shirts for my fiance and it cut out my designs awesomely.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: USED MACHINE, DIRTY
customer_reviews.text: Received today, I was supper excited, I did notice the box not being sealed but I disregarded that first sign. I opened the box and the first thing ontop is the USED AND WORN MAT, it has scratched from previous use, hair and dust. The machine is clearly used with no coverings as new machines come with. The cord was just thrown in there. I am sending back for replacement. Will update once I receive a NEW ONE.
customer_reviews.author: Denisse G.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING MACHINE!
customer_reviews.text: This cutting machine is amazing. All i can say is watch all the YouTube videos you can to learn what all it can do & get very well acquainted with the Cricut Design Space. The possibilities are endless. Just don't get frustrated if you've never used anything Cricut before like me, it'll get easier w/ practice..
customer_reviews.author: katiegirl

customer_reviews.title: Nice but hard work.
customer_reviews.text: For the wife. She struggles with it, apparently a long learning curve. Also, many designs have to be bought in "cartridges" from Cricut and they can be quite expensive. There is some software out there on the internet, but most of it does NOT work with this model of Cricut. All in all, a nice machine but very labor intensive.
customer_reviews.author: Copperhead43

customer_reviews.title: It's good - web based software is garbage
customer_reviews.text: I'm an architect and designer I use this for quick study models and drawings/paintings. It's a fine machine, it does everything it claims and it does it well. My mine complaint is how unflexible the machine is. We are locked into using the web-based software, which is not great and struggles with large files. The pen options are not great for us, .3 is just too thick of a base line-weight and the aftermarket custom pen holders are wonky at best. Other than that the machine is great, but, if I ever buy another cutting machine it will be one where I can use outside software and or plugins.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Best investment I ever made. I love this machine. Between this and the heat press, I feel like it’s Christmas every day. I love the combination of them both. I will never buy another graphic tee for my kids. With this and the heat press, I can make their tees. I make their birthday shirts and all. This saved me money despite I have to buy T-shirts and vinyl but I don’t have to repeatedly go buy it when they need a tee to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Chant'e

customer_reviews.title: No blade
customer_reviews.text: Great ! It didn’t come with a single blade so much for using it today or for several days. How does it not come with even one blade?!?
customer_reviews.author: reader80

customer_reviews.title: When I opened the box the blade as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box the blade as well as a few other pieces were missing. I was unable to use the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Dean Flint

customer_reviews.title: Where do I begin?
customer_reviews.text: This is the most beautiful piece of technolohy that is mine. I love this machine very much and it cuts so perfectly! Yea, it may take a whle to get use to it but overall it's easy to learn and amazing to play with especially when running a sticker shop. There is a catch, there is a $10 subscription to use Cricut but other then that I think it's very much worth the price and isn't a bad investment.
customer_reviews.author: Luxunny

customer_reviews.title: Proceed with caution!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this machine! I primarily bought it to make earrings, but have also used it to make other things. Their has been a learning curve on figuring out settings using different types of faux leather, but all in all, it's great. Design Space was easy to figure out. *A month later the machine won't even cut a full design out of paper. This should not be happening on a brand new machine. I sat on hold for 3 hours with Cricut. So ridiculous! Cricut is replacing my machine. Having this happen was frustrating, but their customer service has been pretty good aside from the hold time on the initial call.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ward

customer_reviews.title: endless projects if you have the time and effort to put in to learn
customer_reviews.text: Uh, why am I now just owning this?! I love the cricut, was kinda tricky figuring it out and have so much to learn still. So far the only thing I can do is print decals like monograms and names for cups. I dislike like how you have to purchase every single thing after you buy this machine. Including fonts, images to print, etc... and it’s not cheap... so only buy if you got the disposable income! Also, I highly recommend purchasing cricut with those package deals, it’ll save you the hassle of buying everything you need to get started.
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: I am not an Internet/Computer Savvy but this machine is extremely easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I started my own home based business selling tank tops and t-shirts. I am not an Internet/Computer Savvy but this machine is extremely easy to use. It's great for arts and crafts. So far I have only used this machine to cut Vinyl, adhesive vinyl and cardboard. This machine is great for a home based business.
customer_reviews.author: MariaMiami

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine back in April, only used it a few times and kept it at my desk, never moved it since then. Then the machine broke down, having solid red light issues that's related to power, and apparently a lot of people are having the same issue. Tried calling help desk, no one picks up after waiting on the call for more than 4 hrs. Do not buy this machine. I don't understand how something I paid over $200 and only used a few times could break down this easily. Most importantly, I'm not the only one having this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia211

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: It nat take some time to learn but don't get discouraged. I use this to make iron ons, cards, decorations. I love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: ZomDee

customer_reviews.title: Love all of the things this machine can do
customer_reviews.text: Love all of the things this machine can do. A little disappointed with the web application and that many features only work from a pc, rather than cell phone or tablet (when in Cricut Design on phone the fonts are all mixed up when I go into the computer to make the item, so I have to start over). Hoping they get the kinks worked out soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, Hard to Layer Colors on Shirts, Well worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. We have created many shirts and decals since owning. One thing I was a little disappointed in is the difficulty to layer different colors for shirts. It is not simple by any means. Lots of YouTube watching! Never-the-less, the machines capability is pretty far and wide and if you have the patience to learn a skill it can be very cool to use. The key to remember is that you will definitely have a learning curve. Don't get frustrated stick with it and you will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Always Growing

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you’re home when it arrives.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is they shipped a 300$ machine in its own box so everyone could see what it is while it sits on my porch. Second really expensive item I’ve bought that came without a cover to it. Smh.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Darling

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing. I mainly bought it to be able to ...
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life?! I've been eyeing it for months and I finally talked myself into it. It's amazing. I mainly bought it to be able to make and cut my own planner stickers but the possibilities are endless really. I can't wait to try some other projects out.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Used replacement and missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a replacement because of wrong item sent. However, this replacement It's used but it's getting the job done. Also missing mat and weeding tool. However, it's still a nice cutting machine. UPDATE: STOPPED WORKING WITHIN 3 WEEKS! HAD TO RETURN THE REPLACEMENT AND PURCHASED FROM LOCAL HOBBY LOBBY STORE.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Mill

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened this I was so excited!! I have been wanting this for 4 years now. The first time I used it with vinyl, I made sure it was on the right setting and got to work. When it came time to separate the vinyl, the letters were not fully cut. I wasted 2 whole sheets of vinyl trying to do the same project. It took me several different attempts for me to finish this. For me to be able to 'cut' vinyl, it had to be on the cardstock setting. Very disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: Tylerbanks

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: My Cricut machine was working perfectly but unfortunately after working almost a year, it start giving noise. I contact cricut customer support and give all the details, including the video on february this year. They told me to just use it as usual while they checking the problem but until now I did not receive any feedback from them. I am trying to get some grease from them as they did not disclose which type of grease I can use with the machine. unfortunately, the process repeat again where that asked exactly the same question they have asked 2 months ago, and ask me to provide video again which was given 2 months ago. very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: hafiz

customer_reviews.title: Broken machine
customer_reviews.text: Item is damaged! Gave to my daughter as a gift she only got to make one sticker and now machine dont work anymore! Talked with customer service and since it's over the return window because I did not open item until this month sept 2020! They want me to pay $80 dollars to restock the item?!?! It is damaged!!! Should of just went thru the cricut store official website if I would of know of these issues!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: josephina

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased by my girlfriend and she loves it. She uses it to make many designs and the product comes out excellent. The only complaint that she had was that the blade doesn't seem to last too long. She has had to use the hardest setting in order to cut the lightest paper. Other than the blade issue she seems to enjoy using it very much.
customer_reviews.author: David Garcia

customer_reviews.title: No written manual. Online help information not helpful
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice machine. I hate there isn't a manual. I can't find help on website. Rounds you in circles. The customer service isn't avail after 5 PM or weekends, that's when I am able to use it. I'm learning on my own, so it's going to take me awhile to feel comfortable. All Fonts should be free, you have to pay for so any of its and patterns unless you pay an annual fee. I'm an intelligent woman and I catch on fast to most machines, this has me frustrated. I need a manual to refer to instead of relying solely on the internet.
customer_reviews.author: MGSchaaf

customer_reviews.title: So far we have only cut vinyl but man is it awesome. Looking forward to creating many new things in ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my wife for Christmas as an update to her cricut. This one is much easier to use than the old one. With this one we can upload designs we want to make into decals. So far we have only cut vinyl but man is it awesome. Looking forward to creating many new things in the new year.
customer_reviews.author: Jbritt

customer_reviews.title: Fun! But don't expect magic
customer_reviews.text: The internet is a great resource. I'm crafty but I assumed buying this would be all I needed to do, buy the stuff and make well, it requires time, patience and a little technique like any hobby. Don't buy for instant money making in an over saturated market. Do buy to make awesome stuff for your family and get better over time, and eventually even make some money with it! Sales are based on originality, location, ability to advertise, ideas for new stuff! I use mine to make unique patterns to embroider by hand. The options are endless.
customer_reviews.author: Millie March

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: The software is garbage. Freezes, crashes, says it saves your projects successfully then it disappears. Customer support is absolutely no help at all. I was so excited to get this. Literally jumping up and down excited because I’ve wanted one for years. But after losing about 10 hours of work on 3 separate projects.... I’m just done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've used the machine a few times so far and I love it. Actually making the design online takes quite ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a newbie at all this Cricut stuff. I've used the machine a few times so far and I love it. Actually making the design online takes quite a bit of practice or teaching, but once that part is done, this machine flawlessly executes it. It's very fast and I've no issues!
customer_reviews.author: L. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: In order to use Cricut design space u have to pay $10 a month
customer_reviews.text: I am in loveeeee with my Cricut ! So far it works great. Can wait to see all my creation coming up in the future. This is also worth every penny , besides the fact u have to pay $10 a month just to use it which is ridiculous. When ur spending so much money on just the machine and supplies for it . Cricut really needs to changed it to where u don’t have to spend $10 a month just to be able to use the machine .
customer_reviews.author: Ayla Franklin

customer_reviews.title: VERY USER FRIENDLY
customer_reviews.text: Amazon is outstanding !!!! I ordered the Brother Cut and Scan and was VERY disappointed ... Forget their " Learning Curve"...I returned it for a full refund from Amazon... After doing research for another machine...TA DA !!!! Cricut Explore Air 2 Machine....VERY USER FRIENDLY !!! Thank You !!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Im missing products
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this and was so excited to get it in, however I was sorely disappointed when I received this machine. When I opened my package today I opened it up and everything looked new and unused, however I am missing my welcome book, quick start guide, free trial membership for design space, 50 ready to make projects, materials for practice, and warranty document. When I ordered it, it didn't state anywhere that this was a used and open product so I would assume things wouldn't be missing. I wouldn't have bought it on here if I knew that parts would be missing. I now wish I bought it through the cricut website instead of here.
customer_reviews.author: Cydney Cox

customer_reviews.title: cutting issues
customer_reviews.text: so much wasted vinyl due to cutting issues and was bought new. have tried to contact cricut multiple times but the wait times are well over an hour. regardless the type/brand of vinyl used same issue occurs. machine drags through the image it’s cutting and cuts poorly on curves or cursive writing. very easy software and easy to use but pointless if the image doesn’t cut properly.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna Brinson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This has become my best friend. I am making all the crafts. Labeling 💩 that doesn't need it. Making Tshirts and custom cups 😂. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: I love the machine but feel that the software could be ...
customer_reviews.text: My Silhouette Cameo died on my after three years and I decided to try the Cricut Explore. I love the machine but feel that the software could be improved. My files were easier to import on the Cameo.
customer_reviews.author: India Burns

customer_reviews.title: I love my Cricut Air2!
customer_reviews.text: I have waited a long time for a Cricut machine and this was definitely worth the wait. First, the color of the machine is beautiful. I love pink colors and this is a beautiful soft pink color. Secondly, I immediately signed up for the Cricut Design App. There are so many designs... some free, some not but so easy to navigate through. In addition to the app, YouTube has a ton of tutorials. The machine is quiet and works beautifully. I’m still learning my way around the machine as there are so many things you can create and do with it. Cricut is an outstanding product and would definitely recommend it to amateurs and experts alike.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have opened a whole new world on vinyl crafting. It is a very expensive hobby but SOO much fun. This machine is seamless. I have the prior two unit models and have never used them as much as I have this one.
customer_reviews.author: BLESSED

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Gifted it to my daughter who is a middle school teacher, she says it will make her job so much easier. She stated it was easy to set up and was able to use her own templates from her computer but will be getting the $10 subscription to be able to access additional tools.
customer_reviews.author: Djp612

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work with 10.11.6 El Capitan
customer_reviews.text: After I purchased Cricut and trying to install their app, the downloader let me know it's incompatible with my software version. As I understand the necessity to keep up and work with the newest softwares, I think the product compatibility should be listed in the product details. Now I find myself in the position of buying a new laptop since there are no more updates I can install on this model. I was able to set it up on my phone though and get the job done, but I'm not excited. Also 10$/month for content is waaay too much
customer_reviews.author: Elena C

customer_reviews.title: will nickel and dime you
customer_reviews.text: Machine is useless as you have to pay monthly fees for anything worthwhile. Makes a great paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Heisenberg

customer_reviews.title: Complicated
customer_reviews.text: If you are interested in getting a Cricut and don't know anything about them, let me tell you, it is complicated. I think I have a love hate relationship. I had to watch videos in order to learn how to work it and get hints. I am always having problems with the design space. You must have patience for this thing! You will go through a lot of material trying to get things the way you want them. I definitely would not get another or recommend them. Yes, they are cool for projects but I get a lot of headaches trying to get them done.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and the possibilities are endless!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is SO awesome! Lots of free fonts and images, unlimited fonts and images available for purchase, plus you can upload your OWN images! I'm not a fan of reading a ton of directions, and I was able to create some pretty great stuff with little-to-no direction reading! Very intuitive!
customer_reviews.author: shinyobjects67

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The Explore Air 2 is a good middle of the road model if you're looking to try the cricut. It does most of the projects that the maker does with the exception of having more options when it comes to cutting fabric materials. It comes with a black pen, wires, and light mat. No complaints so far. It paired with my iPad within seconds. Set up took about a half hour. NOTE: I saw some reviews say they received a 'used' machine. I did not. Everything came sealed with plastic on it. So it was definitely brand new. Purchased from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this machine for it is awesome to help me cut, and draw things that I cannot do without screwing up! It doesn't take much space on my craft desk where I don't have to move it to another spot in my craft room. This color is very pretty, and cannot wait to use it more!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Trump

customer_reviews.title: Poor cutting quality!
customer_reviews.text: I order a Cricut Explore Air 2, Feb 22 2019. It doesn't cut right, I thought it was just me needing to learn more about the Air 2! I have used all different vinyls, It doesn't cut all the way threw or it cuts and drags,or it just cuts it up!I also have watched A LOT of you tube videos to be sure I was using each setting correctly, or even for help with the issues but nothing has changed.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it but mine has a small defect
customer_reviews.text: I debated over many options for vinyl machines and picked the Cricut Explore Air 2 and LOVE it. I completed about 10 projects within 3 days of getting it in and this was my first time using any type of machine like this. Mine, however, has a small defect. Out of the two panels that close to make it more compact, the bottom one won't stay close and keeps opening back up. I'm not upset and don't feel the need to return or exchange it. This is a little thing I can live with since I won't be moving it from my crafting desk anyways. Other then that, it's been one of my top purchase during quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Eva L

customer_reviews.title: BUY A SILHOUETTE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in December and trust me, all I've had is issues. If you're looking to buy a sticker maker please please please buy a silhouette instead. It's the best bang for your buck, as Cricut is incredibly hard to use and can't even cut out a whole page (I've wasted so much sticker paper because of this). My cricut is constantly running into issues, and after about a handful or so of cuts it just stops working. It does this every time I use it, and I'm starting to go crazy. Please take my advice, Silhouette is better because it can cut more and the program is way better.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wu

customer_reviews.title: Havnt even used this thing yet and I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I’m excited to finally use it. But as anyone knows, when stepping into this world you need a lot of other peices to finally get where you want. This is a great start but I’m no where near the point of having things up and running. But the black just looks SO GOOD I don’t mind just looking at it for a while 😉
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Love this, could not be easier to use
customer_reviews.text: I recently got into airbrushing and have been spending more money on stencils than than I did for my airbrush! Decide to make my own and the cricut is perfect. I experimented with the software before I even got it and I was ready to go with projects as soon as it was delivered. By the end of the night I'm sure I will have made enough stencils for the cricut to have paid for itself!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very nice machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my cricut explorer air 2. You can create so many things! You can use cricut designs or you can create your own designs. It is so easy to learn and very fun to use. I created so many things, cards, t shirts, vinyl decals! If I can use this anyone can use this machine. I ordered this machine because it was $20.00 less than in the store and it is a nice blue color.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat! It was her Happy Birthday Gift
customer_reviews.text: I received notice that this gizmo had been delivered on my phone just as my Granddaughter called and said the package had been handed to her at her home! Pretty neat! It was her Happy Birthday Gift! Best way to get birthday gifts halfway across the country! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: A. Frederick

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing I read a lot of reviews and watched a lot of videos, therefore it was easy for me to learn! I’ve used it several times and it’s worked perfectly everytime. I have the rose and it’s a pretty pastel pink that I LOVE. I will say the first machine I got was blue (I ordered pink) but amazon made the exchange SO easy. It’s really helped me get back in touch with my crafty side and get through this quarantine!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Hohenberger

customer_reviews.title: Major Software glitch
customer_reviews.text: Some kind of software problem, red light comes on at power switch, but machine wont activate nor will it turn off. Seems just stuck. Plenty of you tube videos on this. Now trying to send it back to manufacturer. Have owned it one month, just outside of Amazon return window. Used it 3 times. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Mannyspd1

customer_reviews.title: Just beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The color is a bit darker than the photos but it is beautiful. I really like the design. It is a bit loud but it didn’t disturb me. Installation is very easy. If you have your own design you can use the software free. However if you want to use cricut’s designs that requires subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Nuray

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me for Christmas. At first I was confused because I already have the Expression. This one is way better! I love the new program, and the machine does amazing things like print and cut. I'm happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: Received broken machine
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Christmas, used it for the first time today. Loud grinding noise when loading, machine is broken ***update. The product I bought before didn’t come with any packing on the inside, cords looked used, machine looked used, didn’t open correctly, no users guide, no nothing. The new one came today with everything included mentioned above. Why I would receive a used broken machine is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy, set up my Cricut Air 2 and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy, set up my Cricut Air 2 and it makes a lot of noise. I've restarted, checked for firmware update, but it hits the other side and makes a lot of grinding noise. It keeps loosing communication even when I use the USB.
customer_reviews.author: Frilco

customer_reviews.title: My own...my PRECIOUS!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I don't sew or have a garage where I can do wood working, to the Cricut Maker didn't make sense for me personally given the expense of the additional features. This Cricut was the right one for me. I have do so much with it since I got it, and you'd be amazed at all the little personalized craft projects your friends and coworkers will bring to you once they know you have one.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Durham

customer_reviews.title: I love that there is a bunch of accessories
customer_reviews.text: This was my Christmas gift, and I am obsessed with it. I’ve already made several projects, mostly working with heat transfer vinyl. It’s really user friendly, and versatile. I love that there is a bunch of accessories, because it’s going to make buying Birthday and Christmas gifts easy for my husband from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts just fine
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine but the software is basic and causes u to have to pay for everything, even different fonts
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: Crafting Fun
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using my Cricut Explore Air 2. Greeting cards have become so expensive, so initially I wanted to simply create cards for birthdays and such. Once you learn the basics of the Cricut though, there is all manner of options to choose, from cards for any occasion to paper flowers for bouquets and wreaths. You can even create projects with plain white cardstock using "patterns" that come with the Cricut. This machine is fun to use, and the possibilities are nearly endless.
customer_reviews.author: Jane A

customer_reviews.title: The blade must be sharp!!!  If not, you will not be cutting anything
customer_reviews.text: I love mine. I have only used it once because my family ordered this but forgot to order the foil. When I got the foil I could not cut anything. I thought this was user error. I took a Certified Cricut class and they could not get my cricut to cut. The instructor took my blade out and put hers in. That was the problem. I have not used it since because I cannot remember what blade to get. Now I can't leave the house because of COVID so I cannot use at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bollhorst

customer_reviews.title: Default mat and error light.
customer_reviews.text: Received item today and the mat it came with was completely bent with a huge crease. Also red light keeps blinking.
customer_reviews.author: Infinite Designs

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Crafting game has gone to a WHOLE another level! I enjoy making projects with my cricut! Ignore the reviews that complain about design space not being free, there is a TON of free images and fonts online. You'll never be bored.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing ever! I had a CNC carver for years that I used to engrave signs. I bought this and sold my CNC because this is so much easier to use and has so many more options. It doesn’t carve like the CNC did but I can make stencils and paint signs. I’ve customized clothing, glassware, signs, sippy cups, made cards, invitations, Valentine’s Day cards etc. they program is so simple to use and the options are endless. Buy this to get your creative juices flowing!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Berke

customer_reviews.title: So easy and the possibilities are endless
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much. I bought it for my business to make shirts. I’ve made so many shirts, it’s paid for itself and now have moved on to making company mugs and other things too. I most recently used it to make stickers and vinyl decals for a funeral picture board. It turned out beautifully. The possibilities are endless with this machine. Best purchase ever.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

product_meta.title: Cricut Explore Air 2 Mint
product_meta.description: Color:Mint| Style Name:MachineCricut explore air 2 is a DIY Speed machine. This quick, smart cutting machine lets you make projects with over 100 different materials. Plus, save even more time with Cricut mobile Apps and predesigned projects.
feature_bullets: Create more The Cricut Explore Air 2 is your personal DIY cutting machine. It will flawlessly cut over 100+ different types of materials including premium vinyl, iron-on and htv vinyl, cardstock, faux leather, adhesive foils, specialty paper, poster board and more

[Endless project possibilities] The Cricut Explore Air 2 makes it so easy to create a wide arrange of DIY projects. Make custom stickers, personalized home decor, home-made gifts and party favors, unique greeting cards, custom designed apparel, and more

[Included with machine] Each machine includes a Cricut Premium Fine Point Blade and Housing, a Cricut 12 inch x12 inch LightGrip Adhesive Cutting Mat (perfect for vinyl and htv projects), a Cricut Black Fine Point Pen, access to Cricut's design software Design Space, and a 2-week free trial to Cricut Access

[Design For Free] Upload or create and design your own images for free from your computer, tablet or mobile phone using Cricut's free design software Design Space. Enhance your Design Space experience by subscribing to Cricut Access, Cricut's vast library of over 100, 000 images, fonts, and Make-It-Now projects and designs

[Become a part of a community] We know it can be intimidating to start creating your first DIY projects, so don’t do it alone. When you buy a Cricut you become part of a close-knit community of crafters, makers and DIYers. There are dozens of groups across all social media platforms that allow our members to share tips, ask for help and share their projects and inspiration with an amazing community

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars8,755 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
